# ========================================
# OPTION 1: Use Local MongoDB (Quick Test)
# ========================================
# Copy this line to your .env file to test locally:
MONGODB_URI=mongodb://localhost:27017/ucc_ticketing

# ========================================
# OPTION 2: MongoDB Atlas - Standard Format
# ========================================
# To get this:
# 1. Go to MongoDB Atlas Dashboard
# 2. Click "Connect" on your cluster
# 3. Select "Connect your application"
# 4. Choose "Node.js" driver
# 5. Copy the "Standard connection string" (not SRV)
# 
# It should look like this (replace with your actual connection string):
# MONGODB_URI=mongodb://sekhar_db_user:duIt4u0UJmxyozxM@vlaccess-shard-00-00.4xch4e4.mongodb.net:27017,vlaccess-shard-00-01.4xch4e4.mongodb.net:27017,vlaccess-shard-00-02.4xch4e4.mongodb.net:27017/ucc_ticketing?ssl=true&replicaSet=atlas-xxxxx-shard-0&authSource=admin&retryWrites=true&w=majority

# ========================================
# OPTION 3: Fix DNS (Advanced)
# ========================================
# Change your DNS servers to Google DNS:
# 1. Open Network Settings
# 2. Change adapter settings
# 3. Set DNS to: 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4
# 4. Then use the SRV format:
# MONGODB_URI=mongodb+srv://sekhar_db_user:duIt4u0UJmxyozxM@vlaccess.4xch4e4.mongodb.net/ucc_ticketing?retryWrites=true&w=majority
